Entry.1:
Started this with good intentions for keeping it up.

Started working by having a paralle for trenching at 12.15 A.M. Before this had a few New Year handshakes etc. No one did any work until after 4 o’clock & after that we worked to get warmer. Knocked off at 8 o’clock & then had breakfast. Went to bed at 8.30. Received a tin of chocolate from Australian war Contingent Association London. Also got 2 letters from the French boys in Cairo. Sewed & darned all the afternoon. Our boys No 4 Sec. on horse picquet all day after being on duty all night. Been writing letters. Got chocolate in tin box from London today. Brought over by Geo. Reid. Had a bit of fun, wrote a lot of postcards & went to bed at 9.

Saturday m
Entry.2:
Been sewing fastener on hat while waiting for parade. Went over to trench. Two watermelons stolen by the section & there was a row about them.

Had a half holiday and had a Kick of the ball. Had a Kick in the night & o’clock & went to bed early
Entry.3: Had a parade at 1/4 to 7 & had to clean up lines. Had to go to rifle range & fix it up all the morning. Only a few worked this afternoon. The others had a half holiday. Went up to hospital in the afternoon & to the city in the night. Met J Hemsy & walked about with him. Came home early ¼ to 11 & went straight to bed.
Entry.4:
Nothing much this morning. Went out on rifle range, but I stayed home. Developed photos all the afternoon. About 8 o’clock the reservoir opposite No 1 burst & the water swissed out quick & lively. Our troops were fallen in & told to make a bank between No 1 & No 2. They did it very smartly. No 1 were washed out, the guard tent and No 12 Inf. Were also washed out. It happened very suddenly.

Went to bed early. 
Wrote 3 letters
Entry.5: Nothing much early. Had a look at the tank. Very big hole in it One side being almost knocked off. The RE store was washed away & rifle last in the sand. In fact a general mixture. Row between police & our donkey boy but came out alright. Trenching all the morning & again in the afternoon. Wally Leckie went to isolation hospital with measles. Nothing much to do except blow defaulters every ½ hour.
Entry.6:
Early parade as usual. Have to parade at 8.30 & go to Tigers Tooth to make a rifle range. Messed around out there. Met Farrier. He had some Infantry working on our job. Came up very dusty & we left & got home at ¼ to 4. Pay day then. Collect 28/- or 102 ½ piastres. Went to bed early & was awakened by the boys getting letters. Nearly everyone got them & I didn’t. Was very disappointed. Very uneventful night. Wrote 3 letters

Thursday 7 January 1915

Very windy & cold this morning. Went making high obstacles & while digging post holes we found a skeleton of a man. I got part of his skull. Found another skeleton about 5 yards away from the other & I got his jaw-bone with teeth in it. This skeleton seemed to be standing upright. Received Madges 5th letter today with card. It was a real beaut healer. Received both the English & Egypt letter. Am still waiting for the 3rd &
Entry.7: letters. Went to bed early at 7.30.
Entry.8:
Very cold last night. All our men were on duty as 4 NCO’s had a lecture in the morning & then went out & a little road recconaissance. In the afternoon went to Baulac Bridge across the Mile & measured it & got all sizes of girders for practice in working out No of lbs of guncotton to blow it up. It length is 431 feet & 72 feet wide. It rained while at the bridge and it got cold. Was very hard work pushing home on bikes. Went to be early. After going to a lecture by Mr

Dawkins on fortresses. There is only two papers in English here. "The Egyptian Mail" & "The Egyptian Gazette". The paper boys here sing out both their names & then add Age, Argus, Bulletin or Punch
Entry.9:
Very cold last night on account of the rain in the afternoon. Had a parade early this morning went for a ride on bikes to Boulac Bridge & Ghizer Bridge. Saw both of the bridges open. Boulac Bridge opens by electricity & goes out from centre & raises itself .

The Ghizer swings round on a pivot & works on rollers, worked, electricity was underneath when it opened & had all explained. Before opening she drops to 15 c.m then disengages. Was detailed for both guard tonight & orderly corporal tomorrow. But guard is being done by No 1 Coy & have to take orderly corporal now. 

Had a haircut this afternoon.

Hunted up Captain Kayen & just missed him by his going in to mess. Went over again & stayed an hour. Like him. Went to bed early after having coffee & biscuits.
Entry.10: Orderly corporal today. Had to look after washing. Tent inspection & then church parade. Had to check all the washing going out. Got an invitation to so out for tea & worked the oracle & got out. Wrote letters all the rest of the morning. Went into the city in the afternoon & went to the Bazaar. Then met the French boys & went to a Charity Bazaar & met some French girls who couldn’t talk English. Had a few shots at a target & won a prize & didn’t know it at the time. Picked a ball & gave it to a little boy standing near. Had tea in the city & got home at 11.15 P.M.
Entry.11: Cold night last night. Went out to the Canal near by. No 1 & 2 sections built a trestle bridge & No 2 a barrel pier & & No 4 rifle drill & skirmishing all day. Got home rather late for tea. Went over to see the Capt, & went with him to hear a lecture on Egypt. Came home at 10 & waited for letters At 20 to 11. Read them all but they were not the letters I expected. Wanted them from home & Madge. Got 4 B. Hill letters but not from home.
Entry.12:
Cold again last night. Did piering all day Nos 1 & 2 sections built another bridge & a couple of 
bridges
 camels went across. Then they filled two tool carts with earth & made a bridge across a gap for a motor car to pass over. 

Got 2 more letters tonight one from home but none from Madge G. Another lecture by Mr Dawkins in Bridging. Wrote 3 letters & went to be at 10.15 PM.

Pay day but didn’t draw any.
Entry.13:
Very cold last night. Breakfast at 7 o’clock today instead of at 8.

Went to Canal & built two trestle Bridges. Came home & there was a big mail but didn’t get any. 

A big divisional march comes off tomorrow. Major General Bridges & Birdwood came out to see our bridges this morning. 

Got 5 letters tonight 2 from home 1 from Alec’s sister, one from London, & one from Bill R

Cold night I put in here last night. Big divisional route march leaving here at 9 & getting back at 4. Went up towards Cairo & then marched out on a Canal. Very heavy marching. Everyone got filthy dirty. We put up horse troughs & after the horses were watered we took them down again & marched across the sands to camp.

Wrote a couple more letters & went to bed early.
Entry.14: Had a nice warm sleep last night. Went to Canal, pulled down our bridges & made trestles for practice. Half holiday this afternoon. Have to go one guard at 5.15 so the holiday isn’t much good to me except to finish my letters. Wrote letters all the afternoon & cleaned gear ready for guard. Went on guard at 5.30. Had a real good time on guard. Plenty of arguments with officers over stopping their cars. Only 2 through all night & they were Brigadiers.
Entry.15:
Only had 2 hours sleep last night.

Stopped all cars & had some enjoyment. Very slow all day though plenty of visitors. Came off guard at 5.30 & had tea. Went to bed very early. Wally Leckie taken Mena Hospital with pneumonia.
Entry.16:
Had shooting all day at a miniature target but with 303 bullets. Did fairly well all day. When we got home before tea got two letters. One from MG & was very pleased. One also from Thos C. 

Went to be very early.
Entry.17:
Started work ½ hr earlier.

Had 8 men & worked all day with Mr. Cutler on the suspension bridge. Got it nearly finished. Its looks A1. Went over to Capt. Left early as he went on duty. Went round to hunt up others some at lectures & others visiting. Didn’t find any more.
Entry.18:
Had a lecture on explosives in the morning & did a little practice in 
bombing
 Joining two fuses together. While cutting a fuse cut my thumb & made it hard to write with. Went down to the Canal & had a row up during dinner time & afterwards went near the Sphinx & made a land mine & blew up a big rock after boring it from both sides. Came home at 4.30. The & arranged for a football match on Sunday.

Went to bed early. Nothing else to do. Very misty all the morning but hot when the sun burst out.
Entry.19:
Weather getting more pleasant. Rather dull in the morning until the sun bursts out.

Had a rifle drill for half an hour & then went to a quarry & did some boring. Put in gelignite but blew out & then put in a bigger charge but it only shook the earth. This afternoon we all went out on bicycles to the Abbas II Bridge (took sizes for blowing up) & then got leave & went into the city. Bought a pad went to the dentist & had tea & then came home & wrote letters.
Entry.20:
Went down to Canal to do bridging but No 1 Coy were doing some bridging so we couldn’t. Came back & on the way we passed a military funeral. One of the 12th Batt. The Capt. In rear. Came back to camp & started mining by sinking a shaft. Had to fill shaft in as it was in the way for passage of a waggon which was reqd by No 8 QM. They reckoned they are leaving Monday. Started two shafts & after going for a couple of hours had a spell & went on with signalling. Had a lecture on 
suspension
 girder bridges by Lieut Huntley of No 1 Coy. Talked to much & was too far advanced so naturally we couldn’t understand much about it.
Entry.21:
Mining, all the morning.

Half holiday this afternoon so am sewing & writing letters.

Went over & saw Willie Perry fixed up for a football match & went to bed early.
Entry.22:
Church parade & I went. Quite a change. Waited for an hour on phone arranging for our match.

Marched to car & caught 1.30 car to Cairo to go to 
Inter
 national Sporting Club’s ground. Played & lost by 4 points. Got hurt. Not much. One man got hit with ball in the back of the head getting concussion & at 12 o’clock was still unconscious. (being then 6 hours unconscious).

Went & had tea in a french restaurant. Picked our cakes from the side with a fork. After tea went about the street & got home at 11 o’clock.
Entry.23:
Mining all day. Had 2 squads going in two shafts. One kept falling in all day & only sunk 3 ft all day.

Going much better at knock off time. Had a row with QM Wynne about a gyn. Won it too but very nearly did my nut on him.

Got 2 letters one from MG. from home. Went over to the Capt. & was there when he received his. Knew then that there was a couple for me & collected the, when I came home. The rest of the section (except my two squads) were put on shift work in another shaft.
Entry.24: Mining again with two squads on the shafts close by. One almost caved in so we abandoned it & started another shaft close by the mess room. Went to a lecture by Mjr Foote. Very funny & interesting.
Entry.25:
Orderly Corporal again today so got up earlier. Had a big sick parade 

Watched the shaft. Got very dusty just before dinner & kept so all day making it very unpleasant.

Pay day today collected 102 p - £ 1/1/- 

Missed 1 week so will get it next time. Stayed up late to see that lights were put out.
Entry.26:
Went to the big shaft & only had 4 men so went down below & worked. Stripped to the waist & got a terrible sweat up. Had a good rub down & put on clean clothes. 
Wa
 Went down to the other shaft at 3 oclock & had a look & then we put in the charge for blowing it up tomorrow.

Got a letter from home dated 3rd Dec. 5 men left the shaft without permission & Hillier wanted to crime them with me as witness. I wouldn’t & talked to him & they were not crimed. Had a parade at 10 o’clock to see every one was home & the 5 were told off then.
Entry.27: Put in a rt angle off drive in our shaft & had to start & fill the drive in just before dinner. After dinner took out the sets & filled in the drive then took out the sets in the shaft & filled that also. Am warned for guard for Monday night Have all the old defaulters on it so am in for a good time. Didn’t as anything at night but go to bed early. Lent my pen & have to use this thing. Had out photos taken by cinema in the morning. They will show in Melbourne in 3 week’s time.
Entry.28:
A subscription has been taken up for two of our boys who have to return to Aus. They go today. The boys didn’t leave today but one of them was so ill he had to go back to bed.

Went up to the mine at 9 & blew it up at 10 past. Real bosker sight. Filled in the hole & came back to camp. Had a tent inspection & then had rapid loading. Afterwards cleaned our rifles & then had an inspection by the doctor.

This afternoon is a half holiday

Sold my pen for a 5/- but paeyd 16/- for it Started to write letters, but Bert Skippard wanted me to go to the Zoo, so got leave & went in. Had a good tea & went to the pictures & then Kicked about until 10 P.M. when caught the car & came home. Got a letter from MG dated 3rd Dec Very nice.
Entry.29:
Have to take on Water Supply this week so may miss guard. Yesterday’s letter I was accused of writing to myself. Real funny. 

Reported to Old Elliott about WS.

Went round to the reservoirs at 9,2,7 & 10. It seems a good job but have to get up early.

Went to bed at 10.30. 

Finished writing letters.
Entry.30: Nose bled early this morning so got up at 20 5o 4 for a while went back to bed & got called at 5 to 5. (should have been 4.30) Went the round & saw old Elliott at 7. Weighed to day & went 14st:3 lbs. height in boots was 5’ 11 ½". Went round to all the taps & examined them. After fixing everything went to bed at 9 o’clock, but got a message that tank was overflowing so had to get up at 10 & went back to bed. Got awakened again for "Snowy" & had to go down & see that it had finished. Got into bed at least at 11 but couldn’t get to sleep until 12.30.
Entry.31: A bit fresh this morning though rather dull. Got up at 4. 15 AM & went the rounds. Woke up the engine driver etc. Very dusty & windy today. Can hardly see the pyramids. Was very windy until about 8.30 P.M. Went down to the tank & just got back & was told old Snowy wanted me. Went over & all he wanted was to see whether the tank was alright. Shut off the water & went to bed. Couldn’t get to sleep for a long time.
Entry.32: Up at 4.30 AM. Much better morning. Woke up engine driver but didn’t get the engine started until 5.30. Much easier work to follow as the 8th Inf. Tank hasn’t to be filled any more. The 7th & 8th Battalions marched out & it was very hard watching them go. Wanted to go myself. Also the telephone section of the Signal Engineers went. Shut off everything at 7. Saw the Capt for 10 min. Stayed in the Mess & had cocoa, bread, butter & cheese for supper & went to bed at 9.30.
Entry.33:
Up at ¼ to 5 (a little later.) Got everyone started etc. Repaired taps all the morning. Wrote letters.

Heard the 2nd Contingent had arrived & were at Heliopolis. Found a possum in the leg of a pair of trousers early in the morning. Made a cage for it & fed it on sugar. Dusty again yesterday Went to bed at 8 o’clock & a B Hill boy came over to see me Cut off engine at 7.30 on account of having plenty of water in the reservoir.
Entry.34:
Up at 4.30 again Rather fresh. Fixed up taps all the morning.

Re read all letters in the afternoon Very nice reading these over again. "Placed all the birthdays in the book. Met Major Bennett & he was very nice. Told me to call & see him. Re read all letters from Mother & M.G. Went to bed early.
Entry.35: Slept in this morning. The guard forgetting to call me. Got up a 10 to 6 instead 4.30. Went the rounds as usual. A whole holiday today. We are getting 1 whole day a week now. Writing letters this afternoon. Went to bed early.
Entry.36:
Got up at 4.30 again. During the night woke up a few times & this morning found 2 fleas in my blankets. Aired them & have tried to exterminate them. Took new man around to the job & reported to Snowy. Went into the city at 11 o’clock. Before leaving washed clothes went to Barrage in train (very good carriage too. Travelled 1st Class Cost 3 ½ p for about an hours journey. 

The delta of the Nile is controlled at Barrage. While there saw a man diving (in proper rig out). He was cleaning out silt from a gate. Afterwards went along through the gardens (real bosker too) & came to the Museum of Models. In here they had working models of all the sluices & gates of the Nile. Also a couple of bridges. A plan of Cairo (in plaster) in a separate shed there was a plan in plaster of the Nile & all its surroundings for a portion near Barrage. Shewed all canals, hills, deserts etc. Went to the pictures after tea. (Pathe). Liked them very much. Some French girls sang & one sang "I’m afraid to go home in the Dark" Sang in French of course we all took the chorus up & sang in English. We got the best of the deal too. Came home after having supper.
Entry.37:
Went for a route march to Cairo in full marching order. Went opposite the Zoo & lunched. After lunch each section went to a diff. bridge & took measurements for practice in demolition. Coming home saw the sultan going to a funeral of one of the daughters of the Ex.Khedive. All the soldiers were out mounted & dismounted & looked very well. Got home at 6 from march & felt a shade tired. 

While having tea Harold Woodman came down but he was going to the pictures. He is coming down tomorrow night. Went to bed early after placing "Domino Whist".
Entry.38: Going for a field shooting practice. Didn’t for very far away from camp. Drilled just down from the pyramids. Did rifle exercises. Skirmishing & general company drill. Knocked off early. Got home at 4 o’clock. Mail arrived. Got 5. 1 from MG. Dad, Mother, Chris & May. Very nice. Read papers all night. Leathlean cut his chin almost off while shaving. Tried to knock a fly off his face with a razor in his hand. Made a terrible cut. Had 4 stiches put in it. Went to bed at 9.30.
Entry.39:
Left camp at 8 o’clock for rifle range & got back at 6 o’clock. No 4 section did the best. We had plate shooting. Very dusty & our rifles got very dirty. After cleaning it, it wanted cleaning. Again.

Replacements arrived in camp & we got another boarder. Rather a crawley by his looks & manner.

Got payed & only got 102 p. They still owe me a months pay. Went to tea early.
Entry.40:
Went out shooting again. All the heads came out to see our shooting & while they were there our shooting wasn’t very good. Braidwood, Bridges, General Staff & a couple of French officers were the heads. They said we were fit for the front on our shooting. We finished early as we used all the ammunition early. Wrote letters & went to bed at 9 o’clock.

Got called out about my pay book. Letter had been forwarded about my allotments & had them adjusted.
Entry.41:
Left camp at 10 o’clock for a bivouac. Had a spell every hour & had dinner opposite a native village. We marched all the way alongside the Canal & a nice breeze took all the dust away from us. We arrived at Sakara at 5 o’clock & got the tea ready. Also made our beds. Had to wait till 7 for our tea. Slept with the drivers & was very warm. Before tea went for a walk & explored an old village close by. Plenty of old works about. Pillars of granite, marble, old pots etc.

Memphis was right opposite our position. Being only a couple of miles away. Went down & had a swim in the Canal first before tea. Nearly froze in it.
Entry.42:
Got up at ¼ to 6 & had a wash. Went for a walk while breakfast was being got ready & climbed the oldest pyramid in Egypt. While on top heard the bugle blow breakfast so hurried down.

Left the bivouac at 8.15 & got into camp at 10 o’clock. Averaged 3 ¾ miles per hour. As soon as we got here we were marched to the baths (before we got right into camp). The water was simply glorious. The march made a good many sore feet & got a chafe between the legs. When arrived home was orderly corporal. 

Had a Coy. roll call for vac. & those who had taken weren’t done. I missed. 

Wrote another letter home. Had a very early night. Only played twice & played cards till lights out. Had soup & biscuits for supper. Told off for water supply again. Start tomorrow.
Entry.43: Slept in till 7.30 as the other chap got up early. Went the rounds & saw a fight just after finishing. Then reported & officially took over Didn’t do much for the rest of the day. Went up to station at 7 & coming back looked for a few postcards at the shops in rear in infantry lines. Called in & saw the Capt. He took me to the pyramids Cinema. The pictures were very fair. The orchestra was composed of soldiers & broke down occasionally. Came home after lights out & went straight off to sleep. The pontoons came during the afternoon. Looked big & ugly.
Entry.44: Got up at 4.30. Started on old racket again. Did the rounds. All the sections on pontooning. Had a look at all the tapes & a good many went repairing. Plenty of work for the week. There was a half holiday as I went into the City. Bought a pocket camera for 175p. (35/-) also bulb for torch. Then saw about some french lessons. Fees 1.- per lesson. Had a hair brush up, tea & then went & had a hour lesson in French. Did fair & I think I will like it. Came home at 9.30 & just got into bed & old snowy sent down at 20. Had to form out a break down. Found 6 stem pipes bent & 2 broken. Had to plug them up & got back to be at 11
Entry.45:
Up at 4.30. Very dark. Went the rounds & then had a look at the break down. Went to work on breakdown & repaired it all.

Took 4 photos. Finished at 4 & went into city for lesson in french. Had 2 hours lesson & didn’t do too badly.

Got home a ¼ to 10.
Entry.46: Didn’t get up early this morning. Slept in. Had a job at isolation hospital. Took all the morning. Did a little french. Got vaccinated & slept in the afternoon Gave some Pommy officers some news about us. How we live here & in Aus. They were from Alexandria. Had tea early & went into Cairo for another lesson. Didn’t do as well but am learning. Going in the car was stopped by another going off the line so took a cab & finished the rest of the journey.
Entry.47: Up early & had everything done early. Went over to Sphinx & pyramids & took photos. Came back at 11.30 & am going again this afternoon. Couldn’t go as had another breakdown & had to repair it. Went to bed early. Had a sore throat.
Entry.48:
Got called early but didn’t get up. Got up at breakfast time & was taken off the job for pontooning. Went down to Canal & did pontooning all day. Took a couple of photos of native village & a scosh drawn by the oxen. 
Had a sore throat so went
 Did french for ½ hour & then had a lecture on pontooning by Pompie (or rather correcting papers on pontooning). After lecture went to bed early.
Entry.49:
Went down to Canal & went on Weldon trestle with Dawk. He kept us there until 1.15 & we had a half holiday. Went into Cairo with Telford & Marnie & took a couple of photos. Took an Egyptian funeral & a Greek church. Went to french lesion & did fairly well. Came home & went to bed.

Sunday (1 in Lent)
Entry.50:
Mahommed Ali 1834-1857

Got up in 5 minutes & went on parade. Didn’t go to church parade but went into Cairo early. Wandered about looking for photos & came across St Mary’s Church of England. Got there at ¼ to 11 & went into church. Came out & wandered about for an hour. Went to YMCA & read a magazine & had dinner. Went up to citadel after dinner & took a few photos. Went into the Khedive Mosque & took a photo of the place where they wash their feet. Inside is very beautiful. Must be thousands of lights there. They are electric & all round in a circle. Saw plenty of Gurkhas from Suez & took a photo of some of them. Saw Moses well & it is very deep. Could see the marks where the arches had been & also the marks where the wheel had run round. Went all over the citadel. Saw the hospitals, 1 for officers, 1 for 1 for men, Saw their parade ground & went all over the walls round it. There are plenty of cannons there! Each one is trained on a vital spot of Cairo. Took a couple of photos of two mosques just outside the citadel. Finished up at 5 o’clock so went back to Cairo & went to the Pathe pictures. They weren’t much. Got photos afterwards & came home direct.
Entry.51:
We have a sort of half holiday this morning so of course we all slept in until breakfast time. Had a tent inspection. Did french & washed clothes. Had dinner early & went down to Canal on pontooning. Knocked of at 5 came back had a rushed tea & caught 5.30 car to Cairo. Went in to french lesson. Bought some spills for camera & came back home at ¼ to 10.

News about going away. Some going Saturday others leaving soon after.
Entry.52:
Had breakfast 1.4 to 7 & parade at 7.30 for more pontooning on Canal Went down & did very little myself except walk about. Took a couple of photos of bull at wheel for water, wooden plough & another pontoon. Had a half holiday, this afternoon, so, went for a cruise about on bicycle & took more photos. Donkey & Camel both loaded with clover. Boulac Bridge. View of boats from there. An unfinished mosque just being built, Came home after taking photos in to be printed in ¾ of an hour. Very good going. Mail came.

We don’t leave Sat. No 1 Coy does. We go in 3 weeks time. Did some french. Didn’t get any letters this mail.
Entry.53: Had a spell in the morning & started work after dinner. Had a Kit inspection. Went down to Canal & went on girder bridging. Took a photo of it. Got leave & came back at 5 to 5 & found out was on guard & only had half an hour to get ready. It certainly stopped my leave. Went on guard & in taking over made umpteen mistakes. Got a letter from MG just before going on. Got payed & collected £ 1/11/6 or 153 ½ piastres. Collected 6 letters after tea. Got another from MG. one each from Chris auntie Edith, Mother, Bill, Reilly, Marj. They were very welcome & make one want to be home again. Had a little bit of bother on guard but very little.
Entry.54: Everything going A1. Slept from ¼ to 12 till 6. Did very well. Wrote 10 letters & did some french. No 3 came home at 5.15 & were well cheered. Knocked off guard at ¼ to 6 instead of 5. 30. Had tea & saw Frank Gentle. Took him over to see Willie Bannister & he gave us all the news about the Canal. Went to be bed very early.
Entry.55: Went down to the Canal this morning but all I did was to walk about to keep myself awake. Had a half holiday so went down & saw Leith. He was alright & comes out soon. Bill Foulshum went to Alexandria on business & isn’t coming back here to Mena again. Went into Cairo for lesson & I didn’t get one because the teacher thought I had gone away & arranged for a private lesion for someone else so got photos & came home.
Entry.56:
Had an early morning parade & the rest of the holiday went over to Sphinx with L. Avery & got some photos. Went into Zoo after dinner & got a few photos. One of the Gippo. Went into Cairo afterwards & had tea. Louis bought a vest pocket camera & I collected my films.

Walked about & went into a jews house. They said a prayer for 3/4 hour & then we had some type of music by clarionette & fiddle & drum. Left there at 9 & got home at 10.30 Bought stamps post cards & some views & came home "ma fish feloose" 

Sunday (2nd in Lent)
Entry.57:
Early morning parade. Went to Church Parade & afterwards went over to the 12th. Had a talk with the Capt. & got a revolver case made for him. The 3rd Brigade left during the afternoon & L. Avery & I went to Heliopolis. Saw a few boys we knew & went right round the camp. Took a photo of a catholic church out there. Had a good tea & walked about & came home at 10.30.

Monday 1 March 1915

Early morning parade. Got 2 letters. 1 from the bank & 1 from Aunt Maggie. Went down to Canal & had rather an easy day: No 3 Coy. Took our job away so we just politely watched. Made a lock bridge after & took a photo of it. Rushed away & went into Cairo for lesson. Had lesson & ordered 151 prints of photos. Came home at 10 o’clock & went to bed.
Entry.58: All NCO over lance Jack went on road reconnaissance on bikes. Had a good day & took 10 photos. Had an argument with a nigger coming home & chapped him on the wrists. Hurt my hand instead of his I think. Got home 1/2 hour before any of the others & did the same work. Wrote letters, did french & packed my kit bag.
Entry.59: Went for a bivouac to AbuSir. Left here about 9.30 got there at 1. Had dinner & walked about. Had a swim & slept in the afternoon. Had an early tea & went to bed at 7.30. Nothing much to see except graves. One tool cart ran over one & we saw all in int. It was hollow & in it was 4 skeletons. Seemingly 1 family.
Entry.60: Got up at 6 & had a swim. Bedding got slightly damp by dew. Left camp at 9 & went for a long march & came out at Gizeh. Went through 3 native villages. Right through them too. Not very much to see. Got a photo of the boys lined up for meals this morning. Left home about 4.30. Didn’t feel so tired. Went into Cairo for photos. Paid 81 piastres for them. Came home in care & had a bit of an arguments with an artillery chap. He quietened down. Some of the boys were arrested for refusing to pay him fares. Made a terrible disturbance. Got home at 11.
Entry.61: Orderly Corporal today. Had an early morning parade & that was all for the morning. Had to parade 21 men before the O.C. Most got off but some were sentenced. Two for fighting with bare fists. Both got their leave stopped. Had a marching order parade & left camp at 1 o’clock & went down to Canal. We were supposed to have to make a bridge across the Canal under cover of our artillery guns. Well the bridge was an absolute disgrace. Real ragtime bridge. All the measurements wrong so transoms were too low. Bivouaced along the banks & had a good sleep. Bridge took over 4 hours where as it should have only taken at the most 2.
Entry.62:
Marched back to camp & got there at about 8 o’clock. Rest of the day a holiday. Went into Cairo & wandered about. Took a few photos but don’t think they will be any good. Don’t care much as they weren’t of any importance. Had a lesson in french & didn’t do too well.

Got home at ¼ to 10.

Sunday (3 in Lent)
Entry.63: Went to church parade. Came back & packed all my Kit. Didn’t do anything all the morning but in the afternoon H. Woodward came down so went for a stroll with him. Had tried to sleep before that but the flies worried so couldn’t. Went in as canteen steward till 9 & then went to bed.
Entry.64:
Went down to Canal & dismantled all the bridge. Started to build another but had to dismantle before going to far as the RE cart came down & took some of the stores away. Packed all our pontoons & practiced making trestles and sheer legs.

Slept during lunch time but flies were a great worry. Went down to see Major Brenner but he was at Mess so we are going down Wed. night. 

Went to bed early.
Entry.65: Fell in at usual parade but got pulled out for a job to go to Kas en Nil Barracks. Had to load 8 native carts with all our borrowed bridging material. Took them into the barracks but had a couple of arguments with the native police over some of the carts. One cart was stopped so I went on with 7. 3 men came out later & caught me up at the bridge. The bridge was open & had to wait ¾ hour there. Fixed everything up alright & got back at 6 just in time for tea.
Entry.66:
Orderly Corporal today & we started work at 6 today. Had our parade at 7. Everyone went out to do some exploring work of some description. Very hot. The hottest we have had so far. Mail day. Got 2 letters from Auntie Eva & Erna Reiss. Afterwards got 2 from from M.G. photos & letter from mother. Letter from Doris Bollam, Marj & Dulcie, George Abbot, Clarice & from Percy Evans. Altogether I got 11. Not bad at all. Do me.

Went down with L Avery & saw Major Bennett. Asked after all home & was very nice. Had an iced lemonade. Quite a change. Wanted to know if we wanted clothes or money & about promotion. Wants to be remembered to all home. The hottest day we’ve had since being in Egypt.
Entry.67: Went out behind the small pyramid & did wire entanglements. Got terribly dusty & we left there at 2.30 instead of 4.30. A real rotter of a day. Went over to Artillery lines & had a bath. Near enough. Fixed up for photo & went to bed early. Very funny some Sarg’s got drunk & made things very funny.
Entry.68: Went out to our job & finished before dinner. Had a half day holiday but no one allowed to leave camp as there was going to be an alarm & a bivouac tonight. Am on guard also will miss the bivouac. Don’t mind in the least. Had 2 prisoners to take over & about 10 o’clock got 2 more, both for being drunk. Very funny both of them. One had a smack at one the guard & we stopped a disturbance. They kept on talking for a long time. Went to be at 12.30. Made toast & tea & had a good old eat up during the night.
Entry.69: Got up at 6 & got everything cleaned up. Lost 3 prisoners. Old pomper didn’t find any faults with the turn out. Wrote letters. Came off at 5.30 after having been going hard writing letters all the afternoon. Went to bed early. The section had a full marching order parade at 12 o’clock but I didn’t have to go. We were issued with new equipment. Doing away with our other.
Entry.70: Went out early; before church parade, to Napoleon’s fort at the citadel. Took some photos of Sultan Hassin, Mosque & of another next to it. Went over the place & finished up home at 8.45. Saw old fort, & dugouts old mosque etc. Listened to the band at Ezbekiah gardens & also photos. Collected 146 of them. Got a letter from Melbourne went to bed early.
Entry.71:
Had a full marching parade in new equipment. Had to pack our Kit bags etc. but after all wasn’t wanted as we had a spell all the rest of the morning. Had another M.O. parade at 2 o’clock. It rained too while on the parade. Rained fairly heavily too. Moved away at 4.30 (Only wasted 2 ½ hours) It rained well. Marched out to out entanglements & had tea. After tea started work & put in some more entanglements. We were in a sham fight. The enemy came & we left. Major Martyn, Alex N & myself stayed near the entanglement. We went out as scouts with 6 men. We captured 2 men & chased another but lost him. Hit him with a stone while running away but even then couldn’t catch him. Went back to camp & had some tea & tried to get back but got stopped by outposts. Wouldn’t let us through.

Rained again & only had out water proof sheet. Really enjoyed the outing though specially the scouting.
Entry.72: Left our bivouac & got back in camp for breakfast. Rained pretty hard early in morning but we didn’t mind. Had another parade on full MO at 9.30. All No 4 NCO’s went out on horse to view the damage done to the entanglement. Real funny 4 of us couldn’t ride, but we tried real hard & succeeded. Got bumped about myself but didn’t mind. Had a night parade for No 4 only. Did some marching about with picks & shovels for about an hour. Had a bit of a talk to Mirams about night work. Marching by stars etc. Going to do some one night with horses.
Entry.73:
Had a parade with bottles & haversack in battle order. Went out to a place a long way off & dug trenches. We were in a sham fight & these were for the arm to retreat to. 

A terrible lot of grumbling about the food & QM. Had a kick of the ball after tea & got a sweat up. 

Our web equipment is rotten. No one likes it. Helped to develop some negatives. Went to bed early.

Later No 2 Section had a parade at 7 but only the NCO’s turned up. So everyone had to parade at 7.30. Everyone wasn’t there so we had another parade at 9. All the NCO’s got told off at the 7.30 one. Myself for letting drivers act the fool. Didn’t make much diff. 

Went to be at 10.
Entry.74:
Had a full marching Order parade at 9 o’clock. Major Martyn inspected everyone, rifles. Clothing etc. All tents were struck. Had to put 12 men in 1 tent. All corporals had to move. Broke up our happy home.

SMO has to sleep with the Sergeants. Had tents put up & got 11 men. Fair men too considering. 

Wrote letters but didn’t finish them all as it was too late.

Went to be & 3 of the men bivouaced outside.
Entry.75:
Had a good night. Wasn’t very cold although outside it was dewy. Put all Kit bags, blankets etc outside as the tents had to be fumigated. Went out to a pond & built a pontoon bridge. Put all out wagons across. Had dinner & demoulted.

Had a section parade at 7 o’clock

Packed & unpacked the wagons Men didn’t like it, & when we had to do it again well they were dissatisfied. When lifting it up our end with the other wasn’t lifted. My nose bled & making the excuse was told to wipe it. A huge joke. Was thick as mud though so it didn’t take any effect. Went to bed at lights out. No 3 Section didn’t do anything as they were to attend the funeral of Godley. The funeral didn’t come off
Entry.76:
Went to Old Cairo & saw some old churches that were supposed to have been used by the Christians in the time of the Romans. One where Mary & Jesus were supposed to have been in also Moses. Went for an hour & a half tour about in a carriage & saw a good many places, hadn’t seen before. Came back at 6. Had tea & played football till dark. Took a photo of the oldest Mosque in Egypt. 1400 years old & built by Oomah. Wrote letters home.

No 3 went to funeral of Godley. Wouldn’t liked to have gone. The pottery’s are good. The niggers have a round piece of wood on which they place their feet. Also a round piece on top to which is fastened the clay. These two are joined together with a round piece of stick. The niggers turn the whole lot with their feet and model the clay with their hand. The make water jugs etc. These are then put in the furnace & finished.
Entry.77: Went over to the Sphinx & had my photo taken in front of it instead of going to the church parade. Messed about all day. Had a tent inspection. Wrote letters in the afternoon but took a long time owing to talk & weather. Very hot today. Played football of course got very hot. Went to bed early
Entry.78:
Went out a couple of miles & put up entanglement. Infantry dug trenches behind the, & also dug post holes & out the posts in. All the engineers did was the wiring. Do us. Correct way to do things. Actually did some wiring myself. Don’t often work so it was quite a change. Tried bombs & hand grenades. There is going to be a sham fight tomorrow night. No 1 Brigade will get a shock. Making a box Kite to take a flare behind them & show them up. 

Went to bed early.
Entry.79:
Left camp early & went out to the wire entanglement. Had to put in a low wire entanglement. Dug out 50’x14’x1’ & put in the wire & posts. That finished all our work so we went back to our bivouac position. Had dinner & slept. Got awakened to get two letters one from home & one from MG. Very nice receiving letters on the desert specially photos as well. Cheers one up a lot. 

Had tea & made our beds. We didn’t hear any of the fighting. Heard & saw the trial flight of the Kite that was all.

Went to bed & talked till 9 o’clock about Bis.work & soldering etc.
Entry.80:
Had a good nights sleep. Got up at ¼ to 6 & had breakfast out & then marched back home here.

No 4 Section had a parade at 10. Marched about the hill & my squad I took down to have ice cream while the other squad were standing easy. Good move but the others didn’t like it. Too hot making our section drill while the others have a holiday.

Got a letter from Mary & 2 papers from Alice G. Read the account (or rather my letter) in the Barrier Miner.

Left here at 4 o’clock for another bivouac near the entanglement. Got there & had tea & then went to bed as we weren’t wanted until 12 o’clock.
Entry.81:
Pay day got 102 piastres

Got awakened at 12 & took 10 men with me. Went out in front of trenches & made imaginary wire entanglements by placing teacups of stones in positions as posts. Finished at 2 & went back to bed. Got up at 5 & had to wait until 6 before we came home to breakfast. Went to doctor with pimples on the neck & got painted with iodine.

Just before dinner got warned for duty as escort with two men to go to Cairo for 2 prisoners & to collect a sick man from the hospital at Heliopolis. Had to be at Heliopolis at 4 o’clock & just got there. A man who goes there is generally sent home to Australia. Sent the other home in the train to Mena & then went for the prisoners. Got them at the Military Police Barracks & had to wait for an hour before we could get home they were cleaning the reservoirs out & water was running through the street. 

Sorted out photos & went to bed at 9.30. One of my men was drunk & of course things were funny.
Entry.82:
Early marching parade. Pimples seem no better yet. Worked all the morning on a weldon trestle & 14 of the section went out on wire entanglement. They had to work pretty hard & came home about 2.30.

We had a parade at 5.30 in full MO. having to carry one or more blanket ourselves.

Made our packs heavy. We marched out & came back towards the spot for the simple reason of attacking the place from a certain position. We slept from 9 till 12.30 & then started the attack. Marching was good & the formation we got into great specially in the dark. We had to stand for 2 hours, weren’t allowed to sit down Was murderous. After we advanced a little we were told to lie down but only stayed down 5 minutes & had to move on. Our job was, taking the wire entanglement down & putting it up in an advanced position. No more sleep & everyone was tired.
Entry.83:
Worked on entanglement till 5 then came back to camp. Got back at 6. Everyone more or less knocked up. Had a bonzer bath & a big breakfast & felt fit. The rash was pretty bad & some kind of ointment. Simply burnt in far more than iodine. Am going to Matarea to see the Obelisk.

Neck pretty bad got a bandage put on but it didn’t relieve it at all. Had to walk about to keep the pain down.

Went into Cairo & had to grind my teeth etc. to keep it down. First chemist shop I saw hopped in & tried all his ointments for soothing the burning. Didn’t have any thing good enough so tried another & got the same result. Got my photos & came home. Got home for dinner. 

Had a couple of icecreams in town. Went to the doctor & he put on some dusting powder, soothed it a bit, but when I went up again all my neck was blistered. Very sore too, had a blister from chin to ear. Wrote letters & went to be at 8.30.
Entry.84:
Went to Doctor & got blisters fixed up. They burst in the night but some still full. Were not sore but couldn’t move the head too much. Wrote a letter home. Also sent home book & some views & photos. Very dusty today. Absolutely rotten. Didn’t go to church parade but messed about in camp. Was very dusty & spoilt everything. 

We now belong to Sir Ian Hamilton’s Meditteranean Exp. Force. We fight in Turkey. Hamilton is inspecting 
then
 us all tomorrow. Went to bed at 9 & did a little bit of sewing.
Entry.85:
Had to go to doctor had a bad night with neck. He sent me to hospital. Have to report a ¼ to 9. Went to Hospital & got lead & opium mixture on it. Not too much to eat. Plenty in hospital with dysentery & 
diarrhoea
. Do plenty of reading. Sneaked off for dinner.
Entry.86:
Had a bad night, Neck very sore had to get it dressed at 1 o’clock. Much better today. A lot of dry skin came off making it easier. Went down to lines for a walk. Came back & went to bed after getting neck dressed.

Got more books.
Entry.87:
Didn’t have a good night. At 2 o’clock a chap was admitted & kept us awake for a while. Read all day & went down to lines for a stroll. Plenty of men going to Mena. Got a big lump on neck & doctor came & had a look just before I went to bed. Couldn’t do anything – 

Printed photos in the afternoon
Entry.88:
Had a fairly good night. Lump very large so doctor sent me to Mena Hospital. Took back books & printed off some photos & came to Mena at dinner time. 

Had custard & milk for dinner & a bath & then put to bed. Doctor came & had a look & asked me if I could stand being cut said yes so the nurse fixed me up & the doctor cut it. Made a big deep cut & got a lot of matter etc out. He was saying ‘That’s a good boy’ & stuff like that making out he was cutting my neck off. Have a very big pad over it now,

Had to take medicine, but am allowed food. bread & butter, eggs etc whereas others only get bread & milk, when I get porridge, Have 4 meals a day. Am reading a good deal. Am reading the Marquis of Lossie by G M D
Entry.89:
Had a good night also a good breakfast eggs & bread & butter. Had neck dressed a bit of matter coming out. Had potatoes & some vegetables & custard for dinner. Read in the afternoon. Geo Donaldson came up.

The 1st Brigade are supposed to move this week to some island near the Dardanelles. Hope the 2nd don’t go until I’m out from here. Had bread & butter & 2 cups of tea at 4. More reading. Had porridge bread & butter & 2 cups of cocoa. A1. 

My disease was cellulitis of the neck. Getting better.

Saturday Ctd.

Went to bed & thought about not going away. Couldn’t go to sleep for a long time, but eventually did. At 10.30 doctor Levers came up & woke

me & wanted to know if I wanted to go away. Told him yes & he asked me about my neck etc. Said it would be alright & would see Lt Col Wark
Entry.90:
Up early & had a bath. Neck feels better, bandage has slipped. Seems true that everyone is moving so I must soon get better. Broke the strap of my wristlet so I have to use a bandage. Was a bit riot in the city last night. Some of the boys set fire to some bad houses & the military police shot some of them. Serves them right. (Rather no one killed).

Doctor came & allowed me to get up. A lot got discharged to join their regiments. I’m going to try tomorrow to get out. Wrote home & to Madge. Got neck dressed but it hurt a terrible lot. Still bad. Nurse reckons I won’t get out for . Allowed out & went down to bathe. Stayed there a long time & got everything paid. Saw the Inf. Marching out. When I went to bed had a swelling on my foot. Showed it to the nurse & she said I would have to have it cut also
Entry.91:
Got up and everything on foot better. L Col. Nash came down looking for me & had a look at my neck. Said it would be alright but must look after it. Gave me some pills & have to take 2-3 times a day.

Printed off photos for the nurses & took two of them (photos I mean). Corpl. Boyd called for me & came out at 11 o’clock. Packed my Kit & have to wait about till 6 o’clock. Neck sox hough, Went into Cairo to try & get spills for myself & for Dawkins & Knight & some spills for All the big shops were shut so couldn’t get anything at all. Only stayed in there ½ an hour. Went up to the Hos. Took books & a couple of oranges. Had neck dressed & had tea there. Fixed things up for transport to Cairo. Am going to ride & the sisters are coming down to see me off. Took the sisters photo this morning. Gave sister Fellan a small dictionary. Collected £1-6 for pay. Also got a few books. Kicking about in the mess. Everyone is excited. Don’t know what they are doing. King came over with message from mother

Left camp at 10 o’clock. Marched to Cairo Ten of us rode in the waggons. Weren’t strong enough to carry the packs. Got there at 1.30 PM. Got all our caustic horses packed. Three of us got on the horse train & were supposed to get out at the main station didn't stop so went straight on to Alexandria
Entry.92: Supposed there was a bit of trouble over us & there was we didn’t care much. Neck was sore. Got to the boat about 10. She is AB. Mashroba . Nowhere near as good as Orvieto. Went to Alexandria for photo. material but all the big shops were shut. Got some chocolate & ointment for some of the boys. Posted letters for them too. Brought some p.c. & sent them home & to MG. Felt pretty rotten. Had a terrible headache etc so we came back in a carriage. Went in on the tram. Much the same as in Cairo. Had some fresh lemonade in the city & it was the best I’ve tasted. Was in siphons & was nice & cold. Came back to the boat & lied down on deck & felt sick. Just before tea the doctor had a look at me & sent me into the hospital. Was the 1st in. Had pains all over & was very hot. Had a high temp.
Entry.93:
Woke up with a terrible dry & sore throat. Couldn’t swallow spittle. Doctor came & said it was tonsilitis but didn’t seem to like a look at my neck. Probed it & made it bleed. A few of the boys brought in oranges (the only things I could eat). The boys made a terrible fuss at both breakfast & dinner times, singing & stamping their feet. The couldn’t get enough to eat. One way of asking for it. Didn’t eat anything else, except oranges, all day.

Read some papers & books all day.

The boat seems an old tub 
.
Entry.94:
Woke up with a dry mouth. Throat sore on one side only. Boat pulled out at 7 AM. & came out straight away. Don’t know where we are going. We’re the only boat out. She seems an old tub. Rocks & rolls a terrible lot making a good many of the boys sea sick. Suppose I would have been with them only for being in bed. Couldn’t eat much all day. Had broth & oranges. A mail came on board before leaving, but I didn’t get any. Read some "Ages" "bulletins" "leaders" "herald" all belonging to some of the boys. Have a sergeant AAMc in with pneumonia. P. Molloy had his knee straightened & put in splints. Had a good sleep but the weather is changing.

Quite cold now, different to Mena at present.
Entry.95:
Felt much better both in neck & throat. Throat seems to be better. Doctor came & said could go out, so after a bath got all my belongings out & moved down with the boys. Got my kit put away but wasn’t booked booked for a table so have to bum anything I can. Feels real good out in the breeze. Different to being in bed. Makes one feel very joyful. Passed Rhodes Island about 12 o’clock & kept

Passing small islands all day. Seemed hilly & one had moss all over it. Had a look at the engines, boilers & propeller shaft in the afternoon. Bosker engines. We are going almost full ahead so must be doing about 13 or 14 knots. Went to bed at 7 o’clock. Couldn’t go to sleep too early though as the boys made a row going & coming on the stairway (gangway).

Friday 9 April 1915

Up early (about ¼ to 6) Neck wasn’t dressed properly yesterday & the blankets rubbed it. Passed some decent islands on both sides. Had a parade & disembarkation practice. Have 16 men & we are with 907 No 3 in No 3 in No 3 boat on port side 1st load. All right being in the first landing. Have to stand by with full M.O. & blankets & then climb down the ladderway at the side. Getting fairly cold here. Got to Lemnos island. It seems to belong to Turkey. Looks a decent place. Bosker natural harbour & will hold plenty of shipping. Green lands all about & 4 villages round the harbour. A camp of some soldiers is near the entrance. They seem to be French, by the color of their uniform. The place seems very misty. Altogether it seems a decent island & is only about 50 miles from the Dardanelles (where were going). Went to bed at 8 as the lights went out. Have to keep them out as we are in the danger zone.

Saturday 10 April 1915

Up early (1/4 to 6 again). Neck getting better. Had an early morning parade & after brekker had a FMO parade & marched about the decks. The AMC boys sing & whistle & made a terrible row. Have another parade at disembarkation practice at 3.15. Some mail came on board but didn’t get any. Suppose mine will come later. Nothing much to do. Had a lesson in bayonet drill in the afternoon. A few more transports came in with troops. One cruiser goes out & one comes in to take its place everyday. Plenty of torpedo destroyers kicking about. Also 2 submarines. Quite a big collection of war boats here now.

Low Sunday (1 After Easter) 11 April 1915

Had our usual morning parade at ¼ to 7 after a church parade at 10.30 had the day to ourselves. Mr Dexter was sent for & came over to conduct the service. While at the service the "Clan McGillivray" came along side with 7th &
Entry.96:
Batt. on board. They are absolutely crowded. She is going to stay. A few others were like that. Seems as if it is for more room. A sea plane went up & scouted about. She looked A1. Wouldn’t mind going up in her. 

Plenty to interest us today. A mail came on board. Got 3 letters 1 from MG. 1 from Clarice 1 from Ed Russ. Can’t answer them so suppose they will get a bit of a shock.

The boys on our boat nearly bought all the cigarettes & were selling them to the Clan Mac. They are only allowed to get 1 packet each now. Very foolish of them. Had a good sing at the piano. Livens every one up. Makes it more like home.
Entry.97: A couple of boats crews went out early for rowing. Took dear Mr Dawkins out. My word both he & Mirams have got themselves disliked. Don’t treat their men properly – They are too boyish & silly. Had mad brained ideas. It’s a pity because Mirams started out so well. Went over to the Ionian & Suffolk 10th Batt &
Entry.98:
Engineers on board. Got sick after getting there. Don’t mind as is cleared out my stomach. Do me good. Went on board the Ionian & had a yarn with Albert Byrne. They have been here 6 weeks. They go on shore every day. Better luck than we have. Had a concert on board. Didn’t do too badly either. A few more boats came in. Went to the doctor & have to leave off the bandage. Have to put some lotion on the pimples. The neck isn’t much better. 

The O’C’s of each arm went to the Dardanelles on the Queen Elizabeth to examine it & pick of landing places for us.
Entry.99: Some of the boys had a bad time last night. Got wet right through with the rain. It is raining all day. Had another route march. Then rifle drill with nos. with dear Miro. After we had disembarkation practice. Climbed down to the boats with the ladder & climbed up again. All in the rain. A mail arrived but so far haven’t received any of it. Didn’t receive any mail. Our table had a hash made & everyone had a good old feast up. The best we’ve had. As a rule we got good food but not enough. Now for brekker we get porridge & 1 slice of bread with 2 slices of bacon. For dinner we get bully beef &
Entry.100:
a potato & 1 slice of bread. For tea 1 slice of bread. In the morning we get 1 tin of jam (7 lbs to do 22 of us) all day. Get tea every meal. We get big biscuits but one can’t break them leave alone eat them. 

Went to bed at 8. O’C’s got fired at but were not hit. The report isn’t favourable as we have to wait longer for more troops. The boats didn’t do enough damage.

Wrote two letters One home one to MG. then way with the AMC. They had to pass the censor so don’t know whether they got through or not
Entry.101: Another route march round the deck. No 4 had disembarkation. Got into the boat & rowed round the ship & them climbed up the side. The pack seems to be getting heavier every day. More disembarkation drill this afternoon. The Clan Macgillivray moved away from us. Went in for water we think. Had a bayonet drill after the march & it lasted till dinner time. Had a talk on the Dardanelles. The boats haven’t done much damage to the forts. They are waiting for a land force before again attempting to force the Dardanelles. Getting cold again here. Went to bed after doing a little bit of reading.
Entry.102:
Made arrangements to have a tooth stopped. The boys all went ashore for a route march so didn’t go. The dentist himself went so it was a waste of good time staying here. The boys thoroughly enjoyed their trip. Reckoned it was good. Got plenty of bread & fruit. Got mixtures of change. Greek, Italian & French etc. coins. We (those left on ship) had a good old meal. Had a hash for dinner. Had plenty to eat on account of there only being a few of us here.

Read the Australian all through.

Didn’t know what to do with myself.

The boys came back & said they had had a glorious time. So am going to try & go myself tomorrow.
Entry.103:
All those who didn’t go ashore yesterday went today, so I was amongst them. We got to Lemnos at 11 & went for a bit of a march. Left our packs at the foot of a big hill & climbed the hill trying to see the Dardanelles. They was a big hill in front so we couldn’t. Marched back to the Kits, had a dinner & got dismissed in the village at 1. Had to meet again at 2.30. Went all round the village seeing the sights. The oxen have a very pronounced hump. The men use the old wooden plough (same as Egypt). They have large sail windmills took a photo of a couple not being used). The soil is very moist & there seems to be plenty of springs about. Took a photo of women washing clothes & another of the township. There are several townships but we only went through the one. The houses are all in stone & seem to be very clean. The people being Greek. A few speak English but the kids even here ask for backshesh.

We have a wharf made & near this there are a few stalls (or rather shops) Altogether spent an enjoyable day without spending a penny.

Rather mean but only had 1/- & quids so of course loath as to break a £ 1. Got back to ship & was orderly Corp. First time on the ship. Neck has been very sore & by the size of the new lump will very likely have to be lanced.
Entry.104:
Orderly Corporal today. Had a big sick parade but the doctor wasn’t much good. Paraded myself but he wanted to put iodine on me. Wouldn’t let him so he said he would have to wait until it was ripe. It was very sore in the night & has been aching all day. Had the nerve killed in my wisdom tooth & am going to get it filled. The boys were allowed to go in for a swim as about 20 went in. Went on sick parade & the doctor (a different & better one this time) cut it open. It didn’t hurt very much but the iodine hurt more afterwards than the cut. Nothing much doing things seem very quiet. The sea being quite calm. A couple of our boys went ashore to the hospital with bad knees. One being a good schemer & we think is getting cold feet. Went to bed early again as usual. The tooth aching a good deal.

Sunday (2 After Easter)
Entry.105: Tooth better. Went to doctor & got neck dressed. Got some opening medicine. Have started to get a list of the boats here in port with troops on board. Church parade in the morning but didn’t go on account of having washed the neck of my tunic & it was wet. Put the afternoon in by looking through the telescope & getting names & numbers of the transports. Got a good many now & have a total of 50. And have the cruisers etc. As well. Did a good afternoons work. A mail came on board & got 5 letters. One from Mother & Chris with french. Couldn’t understand it all either. One from MG. dated 5th March. Got the last letter first. One from Mabel, one from Aunt Maggie & 1 from Ed R. They came while playing cards & had to finish the cards. Read while playing cards & didn’t take much interest in the game. Lights out went before we knew where we were.
Entry.106:
Had a rather bad night. The boil on the back of the neck was very sore & every time I moved on it, it woke me up. Went to the doctor again & he lanced it. Have 3 lanced now so ought to have plenty of scars. Am getting another one too so am still unlucky. The doc. put some stuff on that froze the spot & couldn’t feel the knife going in. Didn’t do anything all day except look out for new names with the telescope. Neck was very sore when dressed in the night.

Wrote 2 letters one home & one to Madge G. Am going to write to Aunt Maggie tomorrow.

Have been offered 2/10/- for camera & some more money for luck.
Entry.107: Had another boil coming but got it stopped by having it opened a little. Had to wait 2 hours to get the neck dressed so didn't go on parade. Had to hand in our 2s & Engrs badges in, in the afternoon & then took 4 men on the top deck signalling. We didn't do much signalling did more looking through the telescope. Water boat Sunik came alongside & gave us 2000 tons left just at sundown. Started to get very cold.
Entry.108: Had an extra early parade at 8.30 in FMO but it fizzled out like everything else does. Too cold for the Major to come out & address us. Very cold last night. Rained nearly all day. Didn't have ant parades in the afternoon. The HE2 submarines came into port. Cruiser Minerva passed very close. Had neck dressed a couple of times & feels much better. Signal Coy went over to the Novian. The HQ men went as well. We were supposed to leave today but I think we leave tomorrow. Lets hope we do as we are all tired of being here doing nothing. the Hymettus got aground & two tugs tried to get it off. Went up for posy to sleep, but it had gone so slept outside.
Entry.109:
Cold last night & rain again today. Hymettus aground all day. Tugs couldn't move her. Our boys went ashore with pumps to test them but didn't go as it was too cold. A mail came & got 3 letters 1 from MG, Mother & Chris also a Miner. Not too bad. Letters were very decent too. Had a hash for tea & played bridge all the time after tea until lights out. Read papers & translated Chris french. Got a couple of new fresh boats names. Will soon have them all.

Lice kicking about now so will have to be careful. Haven't got any yet & don't want any. Boils much better will soon be free altogether of them. Letters were dated 8th March 1915.
Entry.110:
Neck almost better now. Have dry dressings now. Doesn't look as if the Hymettus is off yet. Had another easy day. Washed clothes & played cards. A few of the boats went out & we are supposed to leave early tomorrow morning. the boats mostly had English Tommies on. Hope to goodness we go tomorrow am sick of being here. Posted the letters as the mail wasn't opened earlier. A concert on tonight & it went off well. Some real funny items coming from the buglers.

Have a light cold but it ought to soon be better.
Entry.111:
Woke up at 6, but we had already moved out. We left our anchorings at 5 & went 12 knots & stopped at 10.30 & anchored. Very cold though. Everyone has cold feet (not frightened though). Neck is very much better & needs only 1 more dressing. We have orders to have blankets rolled (to leave behind) & be ready to leave the ship at 5 tomorrow morning. Major Martyn addressed us on subjects about the Turks. pillaging, etc looting, about aircraft & general war items. Everyone is in a hurry now to pack kits etc. Played euchre in the afternoon & when went down for tea the hurry & bustle was still on so in consequence didn’t have tea till later. At 7 oclock five cruisers came in sight. they were Majestic London (flag ship) Prince of Wales Queen & Euryalus. We land under their fire. We have here in this spot 12 transports & all land together. We have brekker at 4 so won't have much sleep. There are altogether 3 landing places but don't know exactly where they are.

Sunday After
Entry.112: Got awakened at 3 & couldn't have a light so naturally everything was upside down, Had to hand in blankets in & brekker was a general mix-up as everyone got their own. the guns on the cruisers opened fire about 5 & it looked well from the boat. Could see the flash & then the all the earth go up. The enemy are replying so we are doing well. We have to make a road 1 ½ miles long so perhaps a few of us won't be able to tell the tale. Destroyer "Bulldog came alongside & told the ship to get in closer & unload us (6 AM). The Foxhound (destroyer) came alongside & we crossed over from her to some cutter & then were towed ashore leaving at 7.15. Landed under fire & were fired at before we got out of the boats. We ducked a treat. My word the shrapnel simply moved our boys down. their rifle fire wasn't good & more rifles couldn't content with their artillery. Hundreds of our boys kept coming back wounded some having terrible wounds. First couple of boats to land completely wiped out. Officers were killed a treat. We made roads for artillery & dragged the only one ashore up to its position. We turned in till 10 & then came up on the hill & dug trenches under fire. After we finished we retired behind the hill & our own came in. the infantry taking our position. It rained & made matters worse. The soil is very damp & the ground hilly. We got water but had to leave the position as the shrapnel came. We have taken a couple of miles of country. Hope we keep it. Shraps kept pouring through.
Entry.113: Plenty of firing all night only no artillery. We landed a couple of guns & they are in a position & have silenced the enemy for a while. We kept our ground & have now pushed in again. We dug ourselves well in again & started brekker & had to stand to arms-up. Finished brekker & went into trench to collect all shovels as ours are, wanted (being big). Shrapnel started & we couldn't leave for a long time. Our boys are doing well & have gone forward a good deal. Took 11 M Guns & 1000 prisoners. The Lancashire lads are coming up behind & we now have the Turks in between 2 fires. Came back to Depot & had a good sea wash & then a good dinner. Had teas, bully beef & biscuits. Had to fall in for roll call & found we had only 2 men wounded. Told to fall in at 5.30 AM tomorrow & then went to bed. The Lancashire Fusilers were sighted on left flank so tomorrow we ought to get the Turks in between 2 forces. My word they deserve it. Machine gun shots falling in the water all the time, as long as they go there no one is hurt. Not so many casualties today. Our artillery keeping the enemies quiet. Up all this time we haven't fired a shot & have been shot at pretty often. Heard that Col K. was shot in the face. Major B still at the front with a wound in the foot. Poor old Byrne got killed & I believe Terry was also though cant get it confirmed.
Entry.114: We are still doing well. got up at 4.30 & it was too early so went back to bed & got up at 5 & had brekker. We have 2 water proofs to sleep in. Started to move our store further down & saw the Capt on the way. Had a yarn with him & he is shot through the ear. No too badly. Heard that Perry & Byrne were in fact wounded & not killed. Hope its true. Had to go to firing line & put in a wire entanglement. Just got over the ridge & all had to take cover on account of the shrapnel. Had to stay in the posy for hours. It was terribly hot. We were only just missing the shells though being under cover. When it slackened we moved up to the water supply. I couldn't get any further again on account of the shrapnel they had. They do go close almost at ones feet being only a few inches away. A Turks captured & a couple of German officers. Caught in NZ uniform & reckoned they were interpreters. Moved again & got to Brigade HQ. Fire was too hot so we couldn't get up any wire entanglement. We improved lines of communication by making roads. After we finished we carried barbed wire & tools to the highest point of the firing line for entanglements. Fire was very hot so we couldn't do it. Had to come back to the water supply. Had a little heat there. Moved right back to the shore. Got there at 3. Only been going 22 hrs was very lucky a shell from the shrapnel burst at my feet & only got mud thrown on my feet. Do me. Another of our boys got it again.
Entry.115:
Had 2 hrs sleep. got fresh rations though only for the day. We are still holding our own & want reinforcements. Got up at 5.30 & had brekker & told we wouldn't be wanted till 12.30 so all slept, Got up for dinner & messed about till . Things seem much quieter today. Very little artillery going on. Some more transports came in but we don't know with what kind of troops. Moved stores from one to the other & am waiting now for dark to go & dig more tranches. Got fresh rations & just at dusk some Indian troops landed. They reckon we are going to charge tonight. If the Indians go into the line it will burst.

The cruisers are doing great damage across the straights. Our guns have been doing great damage today, have silenced the enemy artillery. Went out at 8 to the supports & dug trenches for them till 2 AM. Rifle fire was pretty strong but none of us were hit. Put plenty of energy into the pick to start but as soon as we got cover we took it easy. It rained & that made things very awkward. We all got wet of course coming back got very cold. Marine L. Inf. landed & went into the trenches to give our boys a spell.
Entry.116: Got up at 7.30. Had brekker but took an hour to make the tea. Had a wash in clean water & washed a pair of sox. Slept in the morning & had to take the section up to improve lines of communication. Went up but No 3 Coy were on the job so left it all to them & came home. Met Will Perry & all No 3 Coy. boys Louis Avery etc. Poor old Byrne was killed. Jim Hardingham came up to see us. Went up on a ticklish job at 8 o'clock, plenty of snipers about. We had to dig a comm trench so men could move easily when shrapnel came down. In the day machine guns swap the spot so the trenches need to be fairly deep. We had almost finished when they started putting shrapnel into us. Hit in 18 shots & everyone burst immediately over head & lumps of lead etc were flying about close to us. Luckily none were hit. We left & got back at 2. Lost the track once Alec Hewlett got hit in the groin while his section were on wire entanglements. The village close by is on fire & we can see the reflection. The cruisers blazed away all night did some big damage. A chap got killed on the beach swimming in the water. Had very stiff luck
Entry.117: Got up at 8. Had a 6 hr sleep. Handley got hit by a stray while on the beach. Mirams has a poisoned foot & has to go to hospital & am left in charge for a while. Had a check & rifle inspection & at 6 went with Dawkins to look at site for wire entanglement in the night. they were on rt flank of firing line between
Entry.118:
Gun & the end of the trench about 300 yrs. Came back & got section working cutting up timber. Left here at 9.30 & got to the job about 11. Went out in front & put in some wire entanglement finishing about 1 AM. A couple of snipers were about but didn't hit anyone. Put in a bosker low wire. Cold. Took a photo of the dugouts here showing how we live. So as to dodge shrapnel. One lad killed & 3 wounded here on the beach from stray bullets, Everyone is getting careless now & they all stand about in groups on the beach. Mended clothes in the morning. Could hear the tommies & turks fighting in the distance last night & Oh the sound. they, also are having a rough time.

Saturday 1 Mary 1918

Everything going usual so far. We seem to be beating the Turks although we are having a few casualties. Didn't do much all day except go for water & lie down. Did a bit by dishwashing & made things look a bit cleaner. Started to reread some old letters but got called away to fix up for night working (some more entanglements) Had tea & got the section working cutting timbers & getting stores for the night. Went out in front of the firing line & started wire entanglements from where we finished last night to No 3 gun. Almost finished & the covering part sent us back to the trenches as they saw some suspicious character in front. After a while got them out in front again & everything was alright. We had only just started & a couple of shots were fired & we had to return to the trenches again. Lost in the rush a rifle & a maul. We didn't bother to go out again but came back (the moon being too high & showed up our position.

Sunday ( 1 After Easter)
Entry.119: Had a good sleep but we don't get enough in the night. It is too hot in the day to sleep & very cold in the night (A funny mixture). Old James came along to take charge of the section so in the night we left early & went out to finish our entanglements. We went out in front of the trenches and again the covering party were nervous. But we got finished. All the time we were out shots were going extremely close , Too close in fact. Nobody got hit. When we had finished we went back & our sergeant nos. the men off & reported all correct. When we got back to our depot we were 6 men short. Nice way to do things. Anyway the men eventually turned up so everything was alright. We finished early, long before the moon came up so we had a sleep in the night. Quite a change. Our boys tried to push forward in the night but got repulsed but not with too much loss, although there was a good many casualties. The boys in the trenches got a mail but ours hadn't been sorted out yet. Suppose we will get it tomorrow.
Entry.120: Felt much better after having a nights sleep. Slept nearly all the morning. Went down to the store & made hand grenades all day. Finished at 6 PM & had to stand by for night work but it didn't come off. No 3 Section & No 3 Corp are on a sap forming 2 trenches together. The Ships bombarded the port close by all day & we are going to send some men there to move wire entanglements & blow up the post, Went to bed early & had my first nights sleep since being here in Turkey. We are holding the Turks easy now & they think we have thousands of men here in reserve.
Entry.121: Saw of the boys of No 3 Coy. Half our section on hand grenades & I had the others on communication trenches. Had to go to sap head to get instructions & went right thro the firing line. Very narrow & awkward to pass thro. Got sniped at but not hit. Plenty of dead bodies in front of trench & they smell terribly. Just as I left we were sending out a burying party to bury the dead. They did it too. Met Bertie Victorsin & he gave me 3 Gillets blades for safety razor. Got the boys on communications trenches & while digging it dug up a buried Australian & had to bury him again. He was an officer in the 10th Batt but couldn't make out his rank. Poor wretch was swollen a treat & stunk terribly. Put 3 men burying him I had to move away but the boys were smoking & didn't affect them much. We got issued with cigarettes & tobacco today. Still expecting the mail. I reckon it comes tomorrow. Am trying to get 2 cables away home & to MG. I hope they get thro
Entry.122:
Went up on the same job for communication trench. Explode fire along the beach from a new battery. 

All mistakes from not entering in, in the right way. All had to hang in close as the fire was pretty strong. The 2nd Brigade moved from here to help the french. Can see a big battle in the distance. Evidently the Tommies. Very cold today. A big change coming. Not much done in the firing line everything very quiet. Sent home the cables.
Entry.123:
Up early & had a fresh water wash & washed my towel. Went up to 

the trench. The new battery killed 30 odd mules & a few men on the beach. Our artillery evidently can't be able to locate them. Went for a stroll to No 3 Coy & read the Miner & Truth. then went on to the saps of No 3 Coy. Had a look thru a couple of periscopes & saw a few turks 1200 yds off & were sapping not 600 yds off. They were sapping round to get at the back of the firing line but haven't much hope of doing anything. Not much doing in the firing line. Everything seems very quiet. Hope it isn't as cold tonight as it was last night as it was very cold. A big battle is going on with the Tommies as we can see the shots from our guns blowing up the earth.
Entry.124: On communication trench all day & in the afternoon went to have a look at firing line. Saw plenty of dead Turks in front & very few Australians. Saw Turks working on their own trenches. Capt Boyce got killed by a bullet. Went out in front of firing line to mark out a trench & got picked off. It was only natural. Very bad week tho. The enemy's guns killed a few men today. Knocked up a couple of guns. Killed an artillery officer. Otherwise things are very quiet in the firing line. Reinforcements arrive today. So we can keep the Turks within bounds now easily. All started to go to bed about 8.30 & got an order for battle order & had to go to firing line & put in a gun near the lines. I had a Squad on a dug out for the officers & it took us till 5 o'clock to finish it. Not much doing in the line. Plenty of firing at nothing at all. Came back to camp & cooked brekky & went to bed thoroughly tired. Too much pick & shovel work.
Entry.125:
Got back at 5.30. Had brekker & then went to bed. Slept till 4.30 & shrapnel flying overhead woke me up. Will Bannister came in the morning sometime & had a bit of a yarn with him. He gave me a lot of B.H. news. Got our issue of post cards & shrapnel simply poured over us as I was filling them in. Got 5 & am sending 2 by the mail one home & the other to Madge. Just after filling them in got orders we could go to bed but would have to be prepared to turnout. Lied down & our mail came to light. To say I was delighted isn't in it. Got 4 but couldn't read them on account of the darkness. From Dad, 1 from Chris, Pady & Percy Evans. We slept till 6 then had to go up to the guns & work on the relief digging a sap as a start for a road for another gun. My services weren't required so slept up here while waiting. It was fairly cold but no where near as cold as the night before. Have a very bad stomach. Been out of order for a week & it gives me great pain. Have tried to get out of going to doctor but will have to go soon it is too bad.

Rogation
Entry.126: Finished our job at 5 & go back & had brekky. Dead Turks smelt very much last night. All the letters very interesting specially Percy’s. Sent 2 extra cards to Percy & the other to Madge. Haven't got a letter from Madge this mail yet. Plenty of shrapnel still & good wars news about the Russians. Read a lot of papers & slept in the afternoon. Stomach still very bad, Went & got a new pair of boots & putters. Got a slice of bread & it went very well. Had a yarn with L Avery & a couple of the other boys from No 3 Coy. Went to bed early & had a good sleep. Things still seem the same in the firing line. So we can't help but hold our own.
Entry.127: Rained during the night. Had a shave & am now waiting orders for our work today. Northing came to light so we put the day in as best we could. Read & played cards & then we had to go down & unload a cargo of wood. Only took a couple of hours & that was the lot for the day. We had found 2 bagpipes & our boys were tryouts to play them Made weird noises but of course it was very funny. Took 3 of them to play one instrument. Half the section had to go to our depot & await orders but all they did was to sleep. A1. Got a blanket today so ought to be warm now. Also got a letter from dad dated 8th March. Letters are always welcome. Expect some more as haven't received the paper from home or the letter from Madge.
Entry.128: Blanket was warm indeed. We are having a fairly easy time here now. Have to wait for orders still. Had to take 12 men down to Depot to dismantle some barrel piers. Too near dinner so came back & went down after dinner. Only got a letter done when it got too hot with shrapnel & had to leave it. Waited till 4.30 & couldn't do anything so came back to our ' little Grey Home in the West". No sooner had we got here then they started on our home. I stayed in my dug out for about 10 shots then thought it time to move. Had just gone when next shell burst in my home & scattered all my belongings.. A lot of poor fellows were hit but I escaped without. Quite a lot of our homes were knocked down so we all moved to new quarters. Our rations got mixed up & we couldn't find them. It started to rain about 10 or a little later. The section got another call out for a few hours & had to take the sand bags etc to HQ. & then came back home.
Entry.129:
Everything uncomfortable on account of the rain. The majority being wet thro. Our new home suffered but now have fixed it up & is OK. Section gone to finish the barrel piers but the shrapnel has started again so suppose they are all out of the shots. Still raining. Good for our water supply.
