The Suez Canal Coy has some magnificent buildings on this island home of ours. Went for a drive and nearly missed the dentist. Went in again after tea (without leave) Don't like the look of the place in the night. There isnt anything to see,

Sunday (10 After Trinity)
Entry.278: Went walking all day. Took a couple of photos. Went into a bit of a fitting shop & did about 5 minutes striking for a blacksmith. It was a mixed nationality in the shop. Greeks niggers etc. Went for a swim & had a long stroll out to sea on a breakwater made by the Canal Coy. Took us an hour & half to do it & come back. Went chasing land crabs just before dark & wounded a few by kicking them to pieces. Couldn't go to sleep for a long time on account of the row on here.
Entry.279: Haven't much to put in today. Went walking all the morning & read in the afternoon. Could have collected pay. It was only 10/- worth of tickets for Red Cross so they were not worth taking as one can only use them in the Red Cross. Tooth I had stopped has been aching all day
Entry.280:
Got my photos from Alexandria today Went to Pt. Said to see the dentist but as he hadn't killed the nerve properly made him put some more stuff in to kill it. 

Spent all the money I had except 1/- suppose that will go tomorrow.
Entry.281: Have moved camp as have awakened every morning with a cold in the head. Moved to the corner of the room. Two teeth giving one fits all day. Went to the dentist & he bored the wisdom down deeper. Tested it to see if the shell would hold. Told me the nerve was killed but put some more stuff in to kill it. Have to go again Friday. Didn't spend a /- so made up for yesterday.
Entry.282: Went for a walk in the morning but didn't have anything to do in the afternoon. Wrote 3 letters 2 to the boys & one to Aunt Maggie. A P&O Mail line came in & snapped her as she was nearing De Lessops Statue.
Entry.283: The Tommies got orders last night for a parade in uniform for today & again later on in the day. A few Australians tried to get home to England but were not allowed. Two big mails came in but nothing for me. The Tommies got their labels at 7.30 pm & leave tomorrow at 6 am. Played cards till the mail came & then went to bed. Dentist says another 3 days before my tooth finished.
Entry.284:
Tommies left this morning. Took a snap of them. All Australians had a parade at 2 pm yesterday & more leave here within 48 hours. Doesn't look as if |I can get my tooth finished here. Orders came that only 101 Australians were to go so didn't expect to go & wasn't at all disappointed when I found my name wasn't amongst the list. Went over to the dentists & got it fixed again but have to go again Tuesday. Another boat is expected in 4 or 5 days & she will take the remainder from here. The Kanowna Took the 101 & the Karoola is expected.

Sunday (20 After Trinity)
Entry.285: Went to the Armenian Refugees Camp in the morning & again in the afternoon. In the morning went round the camp. Some good looking boys & girls there but the majority are not much. None can speak english so of course didn't speak to any of them. The red cross people from Port Said were issuing books to them. Spoke to some of them. Took a lot of photos there. In the afternoon got the whole male population out by throwing a tennis ball "a la Fijian". Got the men trying to throw the ball past me but my own height when threw they used to grind their teeth & I fully enjoyed myself there. The camp is 4500 strong & each family lives in a bell tent. Every family there has plenty of children
Entry.286: Feel just a trifle stiff in the arms. Hope our boat comes today. There is a tremendous amount of children at the Armenian Camp. Even a lot in arms evidently born in the camp. They seem very clean people, much cleaner than the natives here. Finished off some photos in the morning & in the afternoon went to the Salt Works. The salt water us run into pans & allowed to evaporate leaving the salt behind. This is then made into large heaps (pyramid style) & after being in the sun for a long time it dries. Then it is carried over to the crushing plant & crushed. Took some photos there & then went over to the Armenian Camp again & came back past the Vacuum Oil Coy\ big benzine tanks. A big oil boat was just coming in too for benzine. Went in for a dip & got a big appetite for tea.
Entry.287: Did some printing in the morning & went over to the A.S.C. Had some time to spare so went on board A16 Star of Victoria. She landed troops at Suez & is now going to Genoa. What she is going for no body seems to know. We missed the paddle boat so had to row back. Took a hand in it too. Went over to the dentist & got my tooth finished. Have a pretty large piece of amalgum there. Went to the station & came back with the new boys (100 of them altogether) & missed my tea over it too, so had some out of the new boys lot. Very funny here about 11 pm. A drunk started to walk all round the room. Everybody thought he was asleep & there was whistling & all sorts of row started. Capt Patterson was sent for & he stopped all the row. It was very funny tho while it lasted & I enjoyed it as much as anybody.
Entry.288:
Went ashore in the morning & bought over 5 kit bags but mine wasn't amongst them. About 70 more Australians came in last night. Hope we soon get out of this. Printed some more photos in the 
morning
 afternoon. Went strolling in the evening. Chased crab & did some mending. Got 10 letters but still none from home. Wonder where they are.
Entry.289: Wrote answers to the majority of letters. Went ashore both morning & afternoon. It is the Egyptians Christmas Day today. Went right along the tram track & came across the recreation ground. Whirligigs pushed by men, swing boats & smaller side shows such as conjurors, bands etc. A colonel was here today to see into complaints by the men. Again ordered my kit bag also a jacket & breeches. Still a little hot here but the nights are cool. Just the same as Mena
Entry.290:
More city but am absolutely sick of the place. The only reason I go in now is for the simple reason of putting in the day. Received a parcel from home 2 prs sox & boracic acid. Haven't received any letters from home since leaving the peninsula. Sole 20 photos for 3/-. Should have charged more but printed them myself & it is nearly all clear profit.

Am orderly sergeant tomorrow.
Entry.291:
Over again, but nothing doing over in the city. Went for a good stroll in the evening & did a few more crabs in. the hospital ship went out & is going to Southampton. Hope our boat comes in

Sunday (21 After Trinity 1915)
Entry.292: Went & got a new shirt this morning instead of going to the city. Went in with the dentist party, but he wasn't open so went all round the tow in a garry. Got a bosker surprise when coming back too. Found 12 letters waiting for me. Went to church as a very good means of putting in the evening.
Entry.293: Went to the ASC for the kit bags. Got mine & hardly had anything taken from it. Went on boat the "City of Paris" & had a walk around. Went over to the city with the party to the dentist & nearly missed my tea on account of being late. Got 2 letters, 1 from Elsie G & the other from W Reilly.
Entry.294:
Mother's birthday

Some old humdrum life. Twice to the city. Ducked one of the boys from the boat. They didn't want to take us on the Osterley & pulled the rudder out. Gave him two or three chances to put it in but he wouldn't. First he got his head ducked & when he still wouldn't put the rudder in he went right in himself. He could swim well too. Best afternoons sport I've put in here.
Entry.295: Bit rough on the water today. Must be very rough outside, bet out little rowing smack would bounce about. Nothing doing all day except the same old routine. It is really monotous now
Entry.296: Am getting tired of writing the same things in day after day. Always plenty of rumors here, about the different lots going away but they all fizzle out. Big P & O boat in yesterday & everybody coming ashore had to show their passport. Looked funny seeing the people get hauled up by the Customs people & looked at the photo & then at the person
Entry.297:
A hospital ship came in at 4 & she was an Australian. Of course excitement ran high. At 10 oclock (pm) Capt Redpath came round & read out 70 odd names for the trip home. Well all the names read out were the last lot to come in & those who had been here 3 weeks were left. Our papers are supposed to be 
left
 lost at the base. If so Col. McKenzie should be should while standing on his head. Capt. Redpath rang up & had a great argument with him but it was of no use & we have to remain.
Entry.298:
Had a talk with Redpath about the boat & he explained things much better. The N.Z. here collected £ ; 1 each & the majority of them went ashore & got drunk. Very funny they were too. Got my negatives developed & and going to print tomorrow. The Afric is in from Salonika. One of the crew told me about the Marquette being torpedoed there. Lost 120 men including 7 N Z sisters,

Sent a letter home by the Afric & hope it to reach home safely.

Sunday (22 After Trinity)
Entry.299:
Did printing all the morning. 

Still a chance of us going home on the Karoola. A new roll has been made out & we may leave tonight for Suez. No luck stiff as ever. Another mixed batch came in 106 altogether. Did all the filing in the afternoon & wrote 2 letters.
Entry.300:
Went ashore to the ASC & saw a couple of decent boats. The Cornwall came in early in the morning. she was at the peninsula doing a bit of damage to Jacko.

When the mail was being given our we got the good news of going on Wednesday & by the old Karoola. Go by train from here to Suez so we will have the advantage in every way. The 2 letters I wrote will not be wanted now as I will be home as soon as them.
Entry.301: Nothing unusual happened today except a court martial for one of the men. He went in to the dentist with me on Sat or Friday & I gave him permission to stay in the city for an hour or two but he got drunk & made a nuisance of himself & naturally not arrested. I had to give evidence & after it was over got told off for letting him go. I deserved it too. The man got 7 days. Collected 10/- afterwards as pay. Too much to spend.
Entry.302:
Had to parade at 9.30 & the 
train
 didn't call for us for over an hour. Left Port Said at 12 so arrived at Port Suez 6 pm. Had bully beef, bread & jam for dinner. Took some photos & they should be O.K. Had to wait for ages at the Port before we were taken to the wharf to the boat.
Entry.303: Left Suez for home at 10.45 am. We had to stop to put the guard off, but that was all. She is a decent little boat & they expect to average 13 knots right thro. Had a sleep in the morning. Happened to get mess orderly on account of sitting at the end of the table. Very hot work but it isn't too bad.
Entry.304:
Rolling this morning.

Passed a couple of boats. Real hot below on our mess deck. Real hell there but the food is real bosker.
Entry.305:
Reading all day.

Still very hot.

Sunday (23 After Trinity)
Entry.306:
Real all the morning & didn't go to church. 

Took 4 of the lads photo. Still hot. Suppose it will be the same till after leaving Columbo.
Entry.307: Breeze came up during the night & made the whole day cooler. Passed Aden. Also passed a lot of boats including the Kyarra which left a day or so before us. Played cards all the morning
Entry.308:
Mess orderly today for two meals & will be for one tomorrow

Cool all day.
Entry.309:
Pitching today & consequently woke up with a headache.

Pitched all day. Was mess orderly for brekker.
Entry.310: Storm brewing up. Got plenty of rain during the night & the majority of deck sleepers had to do a bunk.
Entry.311:
Cooler all day but still stormified. Got a little rain before going to bed. 

One NCO & 15 men making a party are to be allowed to go ashore at Colombo so everybody is busy getting up a list.
Entry.312:
Still cool but very close down below. 

Rained again.

We seem to be in the right spot for the rain this time.

Sunday (24 After Trinity)
Entry.313: Very heavy rain this afternoon. Lasted for a couple of hours.
Entry.314: Reached Colombo at 7 am. Saw the Seangbee in the bay with troops on. Poor Beasts. The parties were put into morning & afternoon trips. Mine was in the afternoon & thoroughly enjoyed myself. Went round a lot of shops & did some good money in. There were motor cars waiting to take us for afternoon tea but a lot of us didn't go, preferring to stay in the city. It looks a very decent show too.
Entry.315: The Cornwall left this morning & we leave after dinner. A lot of the men came back dead drunk & are still there now. We ought to go & leave them here. Had a big parade at our beds to find out exactly who is here. We left at ¼ to 1 & it rained from noon until early the next morning.
Entry.316: Very rough yesterday & today making a lot miss a couple of meals. Getting fruit for dinner now.
Entry.317: Not too bad today. More fruit a dinner time. Sewed colors on my new coat. Very hot down here.
Entry.318: Big sea started & kept up all day. Played cards & read all day. Rained again.
Entry.319:
Still a big sea. Seems to be getting worse. Someone pinched a library book of mine but got another by the same author. Rained again during the night.

Sunday (25 After Trinity)
Entry.320:
Passed Cocos Islands this afternoon. Have started to repaint the ship. 

A little rough today.
Entry.321: Still a little rough. A breeze is blowing well & it will make the sea bigger.
Entry.322: Big sea running making the boat pitch & roll. Makes a lot of the boys miss their meals.
Entry.323: A little bit worse than yesterday. She takes a tremendous dip on the starboard side.
Entry.324: Bit calmer today & it is about time too. We’ve had plenty of rough weather.
Entry.325:
Arrived at Freemantle at 6.45 pm. All the boats in cheered us & all the syrens blew off. Bit of a rejoicing. About 5 pm a picant boat came alongside filled with people from Perth. Gave us a few selections by the band & was much appreciated. Not much of a place to see tho. Would like to go ashore & see it better. Real bosker weather now.

The Katoomba is in here. Did a little bit of signalling to somebody on shore.
Entry.326:
Very cold last night. A blanket wasn't enough. the Katoomba left about 12. We left about 3.30 pm & at the heads was the Omrah. Had plenty of fruit & fresh meat brought on board. Also good coal. We ought to be able to go some good mileage now. Hope to be in Adelaide on Wednesday. Got a letter from Mother & wired her an answer.

Sunday (1 in Advent)
Entry.327: Very cold all day especially last night. Struck some heavy weather so I expect we will get it heavier still.
Entry.328: Did a bit of printing. Passed a passenger boat. Couldn't make her name out. Packed part of my kit. Lent my negatives some time ago & have lost one or two on account of it. Very cold all day. Very little sun all day.
Entry.329: Very cold again today. Had an inspection of everybody on the boat for stolen property. Didn't find much tho. Rained while on parade & made it very cold.
Entry.330: Very cold, windy & very rough. It was very windy all night. The wind howled thro the masts & rigging. See land nearly all day. Neptune Is. & Kangaroo Island. Reached Outer Harbour about 7.15 pm but stayed out in the bay & not going alongside.
Entry.331:
Not too cold last night. Kits had to be stacked at 6.30 am & we are to disembark at 7.30. Got to the wharf at 9 am being taken over by a launch. Had to wait a good ¼ hour on the boat for the train to arrive.

Very poor reception. Not half as good as Freemantle & that was poor. The Karoola left as soon as we got off.
